result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle M Goodman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerked by SM.

16CF145 - Preliminary Hearing
15CM466 & 15CF480 - Plea Hearings

16CF145 - Defendant waives preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant and accepts waiver.
Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over.

Information filed.
Reading waived.
Defendant stands mute and court enters not guilty pleas.

15CM466 - Plea Hearing
Defendant pleads guilty as charged, Court questions and finds guilty.
Argument by State.
Argument by Attorney Hinde.
Court relates and orders:

Court costs - 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Order to Submit DNA Specimen form given to defendant.  Defendant to submit immediately.
